attributes.action: ALLOW WW2 HERO ROBBIE CLARK TO RECEIVE THE FUNDING FOR HIS CARE HE NEEDS
attributes.additional_details: Robbie Clark, a 97 year old War Hero and ex POW, has spent all of his life savings to pay for 24-hour care at his home in Burnt Oak, North London. Now the veteran, who was one of the British soldiers who survived Hitler’s 1,000-mile death march across Europe in 1945, is now living on donations by the great world public  we the people ask that Robbie and people like him are given the support that they have earned.  though there life.
attributes.background: One of Britain’s oldest surviving prisoners of war faces being forced into a care home against his will after Brent council refused to pay for his home help.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This decision is the responsibility of Brent council.

The local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here:
http://democracy.brent.gov.uk/mgePEtitionLIstDIsplay.aspx/?bcr=1

You could also raise your issue with local councillors.You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
